data.title: Hide ammobox healthbar.
data.body:
Fixes #10036

Uses the same logic as #9758

data.title: D2k spice no longer erases map details & terrain fixes
data.body:
Fun one for y'all to test!

Added a new terrain type called SpiceSand (could change the name) which is only on the clear sand tiles and allows spice to grow there. The original Sand now disallows spice growth and is used for all sand detail tiles, which would previously be erased from the map by spice.

There are also a number of other fixes, such as preventing units from walking over large, visibly unpassable rock details, over the destroyed & civilian buildings etc

Lastly I also moved a couple of rock-cliff tiles that were very clearly in the wrong categories.

data.title: Ammo boxes in RA should not be selectable
data.body: This is quite noticeable in the Sidestep map where they are mixed with (unselectable) boxes.

data.title: Increased default range of angles that missiles can launch at
data.body:
This changes the default values so missiles without custom angles can launch at up to 90° downwards (enough for Orcas, Longbows and so on) and 180° upwards (basically straight up, for SAM sites and Adv. Guard Towers).

Closes #10024.

data.title: Spy, hijacker go out and enter again if given the same infiltrate command multiple times
data.body:
(It happened in every version I tried: playtest-20151114 and the release before)

I don't know about others, but I sometimes click multiple times the same command for 'emphasis'.
Move commands and attack commands handle it well: my vehicles don't stop and start moving again.

But if I give the same infiltration order while the spy is already entering the building, it goes out and starts entering again. Same with the hijacker entering a vehicle.

data.title: Latest OpenRA playtest does not install with Lua 5.3
data.body:
I try to install the latest OpenRA playtest on Fedora 23 from RPM:

``` bash
$ rpm -U openra-20151114-1.1.noarch.rpm 
error: Failed dependencies:
    lua = 5.1 is needed by openra-20151114-1.1.noarch
    mono(ICSharpCode.SharpZipLib) = 0.86.0.518 is needed by openra-20151114-1.1.noarch
    mono(Mono.Nat) is needed by openra-20151114-1.1.noarch
```

I have Lua 5.3 and Mono 4.0.4 installed.  Will a future version of OpenRA playtest support Lua 5.3 or should I downgrade to Lua 5.1?

data.title: Airplanes given "return to base" command do an unnecessary loop (if already flying towards base)
data.body:
(playtest: 20151114, and probably in previous versions too)
If an airplane (Yak, Mig... but not helicopters) is given a "return to base command" (default hotkey = "F") it sometimes does an unnecessary loop before returning home.
It turns out that it happens (only) when the airplane is already flying in the "right" direction (towards own base). 

This is quite annoying if it happens when the aircraft is in danger (over enemy troops) and since it is unexpected.

Here's a short replay. Watch the top, green player. When the Yak flies away from base (first right, then left) and is given the "return to home" command it works nicely. But it "fails" the third time (flying up, just before replay ends) since the Yak was already facing the base.
http://www.megafileupload.com/5v52/yakTurn.orarep
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/28357578-airplanes-given-return-to-base-command-do-an-unnecessary-loop-if-already-flying-towards-base?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Remove editor actor selection tooltip blank line
data.body: Removes the blank line for actors lacking tooltips as mentioned in #9986. With #10026, this provides a solution to #9986.

data.title: Line spacing support in font engine & multi-line tooltip fix-ups

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: This milestone is meant for stuff we want fixed, but don't have a timeline for yet. Also a collection of pull requests left undone.

data.body:
Adds supports for line spacing to the font engine and fixes vertical spacing as requested in #9986, but does not remove empty lines.

Use the `label`'s `Y` property (& the tooltip's `Height` property) to adjust the top padding, `label`'s `LineSpacing` property to adjust the line spacing, and the tooltip's `Height` property to adjust the bottom padding.

data.title: D2k, upgrades without conyard
data.body:
This enables upgrades to be purchased without the presence of a Con Yard, as is possible in vanilla.

There was some discussion on the IRC that apparently this was tried earlier with issues, although I'm not sure if the whole thing was actually PR'd separately from #9106. I'd like to get this in as it is fairly annoying that you can't upgrade without a Con Yard, even if you have the upgradable building, but this should be properly tested to see if any issues do exist (no one apparently remembers what the issues were...). From my testing I don't see anything immediately noticable.

Also check the missions to make sure all the available tech is correct, I tried updating them to keep it the same.

The reason the player is also given the building queue is because if it isn't the case then the upgrade tab gets shown to you when deploying your first MCV. This is because the queue appears to activate once the buildup is finished, while the prerequisite is activated immediately. This simply means all buildings should have the construction_yard as a prerequisite, which was already made the case. Just a note for anyone doing any mapping.

data.title: Orcas have trouble hitting close targets
data.body:
Regression from #8717. RA Longbows might be affected as well.

Tweaking the vertical ROT and maybe minimum range should be enough.

data.title: Fix gps dot
data.body:
More hacks to fix GPS bogosity.
Should no longer enable auto targeting of actors under shroud.

data.title: Fix waypoint, spawnpoint and camera editor art
data.body:
- added camera editor art to cnc, d2k and ts
- fixed shadow and remap colors where necessary
- fixed d2k effect palette shadow index

I think this should go into release as it's a nice bit of polish.

Closes #9989.

data.title: added nawast
data.body:
Added nawast, made harvester target only proc and weeder target only nawast.

EDIT:
- [x] fixed bounds
- [x] Made use of ntwast_b
- [x] use last 40 frames of ntwast_a correctly

data.title: Increase Supply & Demo Truck vision from 3 to 4 cells
data.body: Small buff that may help a demo truck out if on a solo mission. Since `TRUK`/`DTRK` are near identical I buffed both of their visions.

data.title: Add a couple community maps to the pool.
data.body:
Branched from playtest-20151114

I wanted to add a few competitive 1v1 / 2v2 maps from authors in the community that currently don't have any content in the game yet.

Tabula Rasa - FiveAces (I removed two cacti not sitting quite right on the terrain)
http://resource.openra.net/maps/5470/

Sidestep - SoScared
http://resource.openra.net/maps/6421/

I also wanted to add Siberian Road, but kyrylo is still working on a new version which needs testing
http://resource.openra.net/maps/6441/

Feel free to suggest others.

data.title: Restore targeting cursor when mousing over a disguised enemy spy.
data.body:
Fixes #10012.

This unfortunately requires a hack. A much cleaner fix (which I tried originally) would have been to make the manual targeting check against the original owner, ignoring EffectiveOwner.  Unfortunately the EffectiveOwner check is enforced for both manual and automatic orders on the ResolveOrder side, so these manual orders are ignored.  The only way to make this work without rewriting the attack logic again is to force a force attack.

On the plus side, at least this approach is easy to review and doesn't risk regressions...

data.title: Fix AA-only missiles not damaging landed aircraft
data.body:
This adresses the edge case where an AA-only missile is fired while the aircraft is in the air, but hits after the aircraft landed and then deals no damage, because the target type is no longer `Air`.

Fixes #9911.

data.body:
You can send units with "MoveIntoShroud: false" into shrouded areas via AttackMove

http://gfycat.com/HappyParchedFeline

Responsible code:
https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Mods.Common/Widgets/WorldCommandWidget.cs#L97-L109

data.title: Add map editor only tooltips
data.body:
Polishes map editor with tooltips for actors that are not to show tooltips in game that should help those using the map editor (they don't have to figure out that the player starting points are `mpspawn`).
This is not meant as a partial fix for #9986.

data.title: Fixup DeployToUpgrade
data.body:
This fixes issues with `DeployToUpgrade` that lead to crashes, as well as adding support for having 3 separate actor states - `Undeployed, Deploying, Deployed`, with the ability to have 3 different sets of traits enabled according to the state (needed for more complex transformations like Tick Tanks).

Fixes #9242.
Fixes #9996.

data.title: Fix a crash when using the chronoshift power on the map bomber john
data.body:
Fixes the issue discovered by @obrakmann here: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/10005#issuecomment-156841805.

~~Just a workaround at the moment, as `Teleport` has an [hardcoded sequence](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/bleed/OpenRA.Mods.RA/Activities/Teleport.cs#L97).~~

data.title: Preserve the original behaviour of spies (don't force players to force fire them)
data.body:
Spies on `bleed` have been "fixed". So, in order to detect them you have to use either dogs (only Soviets) or try to select them and if that doesn't work, you're sure it's a spy, which is super confusing (and then you have to force-fire them). 

I'm strongly against that new behaviour. Firstly, nobody complained about spies being detectable with cursors. Usually there's a lot of infantry on the map, so it takes a while to scan all of them with your cursor, which already is punishing (but totally fine). Secondly, it's already pretty hard to detect spies. They can disguise as anyone, so there are no common patterns like "oh, I see a rifler, I know spies can only be riflers, so it's easy for me to select all riflers with the "W" key and check if it's my unit or a spy". Thirdly, new players might not know about the ability to force fire.

Please, reconsider this behaviour. Ideally, I would like them not to be "fixed".

data.title: Better actor selection in game by actor bounds center
data.body:
Sibling to #9927.
Fixes #9998.
